info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Macon, west central Transylvania and southeastern Jackson Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles east of Franklin, or near Lake Glenville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cashiers, B.R. Parkway-Black Balsam To Mount Pisgah, Lake Glenville, B.R. Parkway-Balsam Gap To Black Balsam Area, Highlands, Lake Toxaway, Tuckasegee, Balsam Grove, Wolf Mountain and Whiteside Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
